intro: Armeria cantabrica var. vasconica, commonly known as the Cantabrian thrift, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has linear, grass-like leaves and is often found in Mediterranean climates. This variety is noted for its hardiness and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
